description: My own tasty chilli con carne, served on hot homemade pancakes with sour cream, sweet chilli sauce and grated tasty cheese and freshly chopped chives.
name: Chilli Con Carne Pancakes with Cheese Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 400g can 4 bean mix (or can use kidney beans)
1 medium carrot, peeled and small diced
2 corn cobs, take the kernels off them and throw the husks
300g red caPicum, of cored and deseeded small diced
milk (to mix to a thick dropping consistency-for pancakes)
0.5 bunch chives, freshly chopped (for garnish, optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the oil in the pot and fry off the onion and add the garlic and cook through an extra minute.
Add the meat and cook till seperated and browned. Add all the dried herbs and spices, stock powder and cook a further 2 minutes stirring well. Add the tomato paste and stir for another minute.

Add the tomatoes, carrots, corn, beans Worcestershire sauce and 1 cup of water, add the chili sauce and stir, add any remaining ingredients for the con carne sauce. Simmer for 45 minutes or till meat is cooked and tender.

Make the pancake mix. Make a well in the dry ingredients and break the eggs in the middle, pour in the melted butter and whisk with some milk to make a smooth batter, should be a thick dropping consistency. Set aside. Leave it to rest for 20 minutes.

In non-stick pan or crepe pan and leave on medium heat so as not to burn, try a small amount of the batter to get the temperature right, should only take a couple of mins on the first side, (make these while your chilli is cooking.) When it starts to bubble on top you can flip it, then cook on other side till cooked through, about 3 minutes, keep warm on a plate whilst you cook the rest.

Put the sour cream in a bowl, have another bowl with the cheese and a smaller one with the chopped chives and then your bottle of sweet chilli sauce with a stack of pancakes and the chilli con carne in a nice casserole dish for your guests to help themselves,
